name: term
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: term
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fixed period of time that something lasts for

example.eg: He served a short term for drunk driving.
example.egtrans: 他因酒后开车而短期入狱。

example.eg: He was sentenced to a 150-year prison term for cheating thousands of ordinary people out of their savings.
example.egtrans: 他因诈骗几千人的积蓄而被判入狱150年。

example.eg: The government's term of office (= the period in which they have power) expires at the end of the year.
example.egtrans: 这届政府的任期年底届满。

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the periods into which a year is divided at school, college, or university

example.eg: In Britain, the spring term starts in January and ends just before Easter.
example.egtrans: 在英国，春季学期从一月份开始，到复活节前夕结束。

example.eg: Our college has three terms that we call trimesters.
example.egtrans: 我们的大学有三个学期，我们称之为三学期制。

example.eg: We're very busy in term-time (= during the term).
example.egtrans: 学期里我们很忙。

trans_examp.trans_en: the period of time that a legal agreement lasts for

example.eg: The lease on our house is near the end of its term.
example.egtrans: 我们房子的租赁期快满了。

trans_examp.trans_en: the end of a pregnancy when a baby is expected to be born

example.eg: Her last pregnancy went to term (= the baby was born after the expected number of weeks).
example.egtrans: 她上次怀孕是足月生的。

example.eg: a full-term pregnancy
example.egtrans: 足月妊娠

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: for a long, medium, or short period of time in the future

example.eg: This decision will cost us more in the short term, but will be beneficial in the long term.
example.egtrans: 这一决定短期来说我们的代价会较大，但从长期看是有益处的。

dsense.name: term
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a word or expression used in relation to a particular subject, often to describe something official or technical

example.eg: "Without let or hindrance" is a legal term that means "freely".
example.egtrans: “毫无阻碍地”是法律用语，意思为“自由地”。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an unkind or unpleasant name to call someone
a kind or friendly name to call someone
used to describe which particular area of a subject you are discussing
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 在…方面；从…方面来说；根据…来看

example.eg: In financial terms, the project was not a success.
example.egtrans: 从经济方面来说，这个项目并不成功。

example.eg: In terms of money, I was better off in my last job.
example.egtrans: 就挣钱而言，我上一份工作挣得更多。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 毫不含糊地，直截了当地

example.eg: She told him what she thought of his behaviour in no uncertain terms (= she made her disapproval very clear).
example.egtrans: 她直截了当地告诉了他自己对他的行为有何看法。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: using language that clearly shows your feelings

example.eg: He complained in the strongest terms.
example.egtrans: 他以极其强烈的措词表达了自己的不满。

example.eg: She spoke of his achievements in glowing terms (= in a very approving way).
example.egtrans: 谈到他的成就，她赞不绝口。

dsense.name: term
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the conditions that control an agreement, arrangement, or activity

example.eg: terms of employment
example.egtrans: 雇佣条款

example.eg: Under the terms of their contract, employees must give three months' notice if they leave.
example.egtrans: 根据合同条款，雇员离职必须提前3个月通知公司。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you buy something on easy terms, you pay for it over a period of time.
having the same rights, treatment, etc.

example.eg: All companies will compete for the government contract on equal terms.
example.egtrans: 所有公司将平等竞争政府的合同。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the matters to which a study or report is limited

name: term
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give something a name or to describe it with a particular expression

example.eg: Technically, a horse that is smaller than 1.5 metres at the shoulder is termed a pony.
example.egtrans: 严格地说，肩高低于1.5米的马称为矮种马。

name: -term
posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

example.eg: The project will have long-term benefits.
example.egtrans: 这个项目将带来长期的好处。
